briefdescription.para: Enable/disable data ready interrupt. If the DMP is on, the DMP interrupt is enabled. Otherwise, the data ready interrupt is used.
Register dump for testing.
Read from a single register. NOTE: The memory and FIFO read/write registers cannot be accessed.

Initialize hardware. Initial configuration: Gyro FSR: +/- 2000DPS Accel FSR +/- 2G DLPF: 42Hz FIFO rate: 50Hz Clock source: Gyro PLL FIFO: Disabled. Data ready interrupt: Disabled, active low, unlatched.

Enter low-power accel-only mode. In low-power accel mode, the chip goes to sleep and only wakes up to sample the accelerometer at one of the following frequencies: MPU6050: 1.25Hz, 5Hz, 20Hz, 40Hz MPU6500: 1.25Hz, 2.5Hz, 5Hz, 10Hz, 20Hz, 40Hz, 80Hz, 160Hz, 320Hz, 640Hz If the requested rate is not one listed above, the device will be set to the next highest rate. Requesting a rate above the maximum supported frequency will result in an error. To select a fractional wake-up frequency, round down the value passed to rate.

parameterdescription.para: Minimum sampling rate, or zero to disable LP accel mode.

briefdescription.para: Read raw gyro data directly from the registers.

parameterdescription.para: Timestamp in milliseconds. Null if not needed.

briefdescription.para: Read raw accel data directly from the registers.

parameterdescription.para: Timestamp in milliseconds. Null if not needed.

briefdescription.para: Read temperature data directly from the registers.

parameterdescription.para: Timestamp in milliseconds. Null if not needed.

briefdescription.para: Push biases to the accel bias registers. This function expects biases relative to the current sensor output, and these biases will be added to the factory-supplied values.
Reset FIFO read/write pointers.
Get the gyro full-scale range.
Set the gyro full-scale range.
Get the accel full-scale range.
Set the accel full-scale range.
Get the current DLPF setting.
Set digital low pass filter. The following LPF settings are supported: 188, 98, 42, 20, 10, 5.
Get sampling rate.
Set sampling rate. Sampling rate must be between 4Hz and 1kHz.
Get compass sampling rate.
Set compass sampling rate. The compass on the auxiliary I2C bus is read by the MPU hardware at a maximum of 100Hz. The actual rate can be set to a fraction of the gyro sampling rate.

detaileddescription.para:
WARNING: The new rate may be different than what was requested. Call mpu_get_compass_sample_rate to check the actual setting.
rate
Desired compass sampling rate (Hz).
0 if successful.

briefdescription.para: Get gyro sensitivity scale factor.

parameterdescription.para: Conversion from hardware units to dps.

briefdescription.para: Get accel sensitivity scale factor.

parameterdescription.para: Conversion from hardware units to g's.

briefdescription.para: Get current FIFO configuration. sensors can contain a combination of the following flags: INV_X_GYRO, INV_Y_GYRO, INV_Z_GYRO INV_XYZ_GYRO INV_XYZ_ACCEL
Select which sensors are pushed to FIFO. sensors can contain a combination of the following flags: INV_X_GYRO, INV_Y_GYRO, INV_Z_GYRO INV_XYZ_GYRO INV_XYZ_ACCEL

parameterdescription.para: Mask of sensors to push to FIFO.

briefdescription.para: Get current power state.
Turn specific sensors on/off. sensors can contain a combination of the following flags: INV_X_GYRO, INV_Y_GYRO, INV_Z_GYRO INV_XYZ_GYRO INV_XYZ_ACCEL INV_XYZ_COMPASS
Read the MPU interrupt status registers.

memberdef.argsstring: (short *gyro, short *accel, unsigned long *timestamp, unsigned char *sensors, unsigned char *more)
memberdef.name: mpu_read_fifo

briefdescription.para: Get one packet from the FIFO. If sensors does not contain a particular sensor, disregard the data returned to that pointer. sensors can contain a combination of the following flags: INV_X_GYRO, INV_Y_GYRO, INV_Z_GYRO INV_XYZ_GYRO INV_XYZ_ACCEL If the FIFO has no new data, sensors will be zero. If the FIFO is disabled, sensors will be zero and this function will return a non-zero error code.

parameterdescription.para: Mask of sensors read from FIFO.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned short length, unsigned char *data, unsigned char *more)
memberdef.name: mpu_read_fifo_stream

briefdescription.para: Get one unparsed packet from the FIFO. This function should be used if the packet is to be parsed elsewhere.
Set device to bypass mode.
Set interrupt level.

parameterdescription.para: 1 for active low, 0 for active high.

briefdescription.para: Enable latched interrupts. Any MPU register will clear the interrupt.

Trigger gyro/accel/compass self-test. On success/error, the self-test returns a mask representing the sensor(s) that failed. For each bit, a one (1) represents a "pass" case; conversely, a zero (0) indicates a failure.

detaileddescription.para: The mask is defined as follows: Bit 0: Gyro. Bit 1: Accel. Bit 2: Compass.
Currently, the hardware self-test is unsupported for MPU6500. However, this function can still be used to obtain the accel and gyro biases.

This function must be called with the device either face-up or face-down (z-axis is parallel to gravity).
gyro
Gyro biases in q16 format.
accel
Accel biases (if applicable) in q16 format.
Result mask (see above).

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned short mem_addr, unsigned short length, unsigned char *data)
memberdef.name: mpu_write_mem

briefdescription.para: Write to the DMP memory. This function prevents I2C writes past the bank boundaries. The DMP memory is only accessible when the chip is awake.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned short mem_addr, unsigned short length, unsigned char *data)
memberdef.name: mpu_read_mem

briefdescription.para: Read from the DMP memory. This function prevents I2C reads past the bank boundaries. The DMP memory is only accessible when the chip is awake.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned short length, const unsigned char *firmware, unsigned short start_addr, unsigned short sample_rate)
memberdef.name: mpu_load_firmware

briefdescription.para: Load and verify DMP image.

parameterdescription.para: Starting address of DMP code memory.
Fixed sampling rate used when DMP is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Enable/disable DMP support.
Get DMP state.
Read raw compass data.

parameterdescription.para: Timestamp in milliseconds. Null if not needed.

briefdescription.para: Get the compass full-scale range.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned short thresh, unsigned char time, unsigned char lpa_freq)
memberdef.name: mpu_lp_motion_interrupt

briefdescription.para: Enters LP accel motion interrupt mode. The behavior of this feature is very different between the MPU6050 and the MPU6500. Each chip's version of this feature is explained below.

detaileddescription.para: MPU6050: When this mode is first enabled, the hardware captures a single accel sample, and subsequent samples are compared with this one to determine if the device is in motion. Therefore, whenever this "locked" sample needs to be changed, this function must be called again.
The hardware motion threshold can be between 32mg and 8160mg in 32mg increments.
Low-power accel mode supports the following frequencies: 1.25Hz, 5Hz, 20Hz, 40Hz
MPU6500: Unlike the MPU6050 version, the hardware does not "lock in" a reference sample. The hardware monitors the accel data and detects any large change over a short period of time.
The hardware motion threshold can be between 4mg and 1020mg in 4mg increments.
MPU6500 Low-power accel mode supports the following frequencies: 1.25Hz, 2.5Hz, 5Hz, 10Hz, 20Hz, 40Hz, 80Hz, 160Hz, 320Hz, 640Hz

NOTES: The driver will round down thresh to the nearest supported value if an unsupported threshold is selected. To select a fractional wake-up frequency, round down the value passed to lpa_freq. The MPU6500 does not support a delay parameter. If this function is used for the MPU6500, the value passed to time will be ignored. To disable this mode, set lpa_freq to zero. The driver will restore the previous configuration.

parameterdescription.para: Duration in milliseconds that the accel data must exceed thresh before motion is reported.
Minimum sampling rate, or zero to disable.

briefdescription.para: An I2C-based driver for Invensense gyroscopes.

detaileddescription.para: This driver currently works for the following devices: MPU6050 MPU6500 MPU9150 (or MPU6050 w/ AK8975 on the auxiliary bus) MPU9250 (or MPU6500 w/ AK8963 on the auxiliary bus)
